title: Basic Pizza Dough
description: There’s only one thing better than pizza, and that’s homemade pizza, which is just one reason why our simple dough recipe is a game-changer. The other? You don’t need a fancy pizza stone or special oven to enjoy it. Easily customized for a sumptuous weeknight dinner or a festive weekend party, our three awesome pies (Tex-Mex Taco Pizza, Creamy Broccoli Alfredo Pizza, and Buffalo Chicken SpinachPizza) feature one of two sauces—a zesty cilantro pesto or a garlicky Alfredo-style sauce—that create the ideal backdrop for a night of DIY fun. Just make the dough and sauces, set out your favorite toppings, and let your friends and family design their own sensational pies. Mangia!

ingredients.name: olive oil
ingredients.preparation: plus more to grease bowl and dough

instructions: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water.
Stir in sugar and set aside for 10 minutes.
In another small bowl, mix agave, salt, oil, and water, and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine flour and ½ cup cornmeal.
Add dissolved yeast and agave-oil mixture, and stir with a wooden spoon until dough comes away from sides of bowl and forms a ball.
If too sticky, sprinkle a teaspoon more flour.
Alternatively, use a food processor or stand mixer to mix dough.
Onto a lightly floured surface, scrape out dough and knead until smooth, about 5 to 10 minutes.
Into a lightly greased large bowl, transfer dough, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise 1 hour.
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper and sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons cornmeal.
Onto a lightly floured surface, roll each ball of dough into a circle to the desired thickness.
Lightly dust with additional teaspoon of flour if dough is too sticky.
Place rolled dough on prepared baking sheets and brush edges with oil.
Garnish pizzas with desired toppings, and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until crust is browned.
